result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L. Nickolai was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:11 AM Defendant Matthew L. Nickolai in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All appearances by telephone. Agreement stated - w/held sentence, 2yrs probation, costs, DNA sample/surcharge, AODA if agent requires, full time work, counseling deemed necessary. Court reviews Def's right to be present in court. Def understands and is comfortable proceeding today. State gives sentencing remarks. Sentencing remarks by Atty Bennett. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow recommendation. Withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Bond forfeiture addressed. State asks that forfeiture be completed. No objection. Court advises Atty Bennett to submit bill. Bond to be applied to costs and balance forfeited to County. State advises credit of 4 days if revoked. Atty Bennett stipulates to 4 days. Court orders 4 days credit if revoked. Court clarified conditions - counseling and AODA at discretion of agent, and maintain full time work 30 hrs/wk or applying for at least 5 jobs/wk that qualified for. Def may suspend pmts until final bill. If more owed, should continue pmts until paid.
Payment hearing on June 3, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 2, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Payment hearing on May 6, 2020 at 10:00 am.

Def given petition for court-appointed attorney. Court will review as soon as filed. Def advised to fill out completely. Off the record for scheduling. Court will have Def return in front of him instead of regular status conference.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 2, 2019 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Gabriel G. Siehr in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:26 a.m. Was scheduled for 10:00 a.m. Def does not appear. Notice was sent to Def. Court reviews case. State requests warrant, body only, statewide, and for Court to complete bond forfeiture. Atty Siehr asks Def be able to post bond, gives reasons. Response by State. Court authorizes body only warrant, statewide. Court forfeits $300 bond to county.
Sentencing hearing on May 12, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew L. Nickolai in court with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:01 p.m. State gives plea agreement, DRI ct's 1 & 3, plea to ct 2, withheld sentence 2 years, AODA, 60 days jail, costs, DNA surcharge, Counseling deemed by agent, 5 days credit.  Atty Siehr would like to go through with plea and have sentencing at a later date. State agrees with adjourning sentencing and defendant will commence jail the date of sentencing.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charge and penalties.  Def. admits prior conviction. Ct 2 Poss of THC 2nd offense, repeater, no contest plea. DRI Ct's 1 & 3.  Def. advised of constitutional rights and J.T. rights. Def. understands elements.  Atty Siehr is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Poss of THC 2nd offense, repeater in ct 2. Court will suspend proceeding today and will adjourn sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew L. Nickolai in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:31 p.m. Def will waive preliminary hrg. Waiver filed, Court reviews with Def. Court finds waiver freely & voluntarily made. Information filed, copy received, reading waived, reserve juris. obj. and enter not guilty pleas. Def agrees. Court receives not guilty pleas to all cts. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record. Date set for status conf. Def does not have to appear but should keep in contact with atty. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
